bill.constitutionalAuthorityStatementText: [Congressional Record Volume 169, Number 78 (Tuesday, May 9, 2023)][House]From the Congressional Record Online through the Government Publishing Office [www.gpo.gov]By Mr. MOSKOWITZ:H.R. 3155.Congress has the power to enact this legislation pursuantto the following:Pursuant to clause 3(d)(1) of rule XIII of the Rules of theHouse of Representatives, the Committee find the authorityfor this legislation in article I, section 8 of theConstitution.The single subject of this legislation is:Gun Violence Prevention[Page H2173]

latestAction.text: Read twice and referred to the Committee on the Judiciary.

item.title: Gun Violence Prevention and Community Safety Act of 2023

latestAction.text: Referred to the Subcommittee on Health.

item.title: Gun Violence Prevention and Community Safety Act of 2023

latestAction.text: Read twice and referred to the Committee on Finance.

item.text: Referred to the House Committee on the Judiciary.

bill.title: Protecting the Second Amendment through Responsible Gun Ownership Act

item.title: Protecting the Second Amendment through Responsible Gun Ownership Act
Protecting the Second Amendment through Responsible Gun Ownership Act
To amend title 18, United States Code, to prohibit the purchase of a semiautomatic assault weapon by, and the sale of such a weapon to, individuals under 25 years of age, and for other purposes.

latestAction.text: Referred to the House Committee on the Judiciary.

dublinCore.dc:rights: Pursuant to Title 17 Section 105 of the United States Code, this file is not subject to copyright protection and is in the public domain.
dublinCore.dc:contributor: Congressional Research Service, Library of Congress
dublinCore.dc:description: This file contains bill summaries and statuses for federal legislation. A bill summary describes the most significant provisions of a piece of legislation and details the effects the legislative text may have on current law and federal programs. Bill summaries are authored by the Congressional Research Service (CRS) of the Library of Congress. As stated in Public Law 91-510 (2 USC 166 (d)(6)), one of the duties of CRS is "to prepare summaries and digests of bills and resolutions of a public general nature introduced in the Senate or House of Representatives". For more information, refer to the User Guide that accompanies this file.
